article.headline: Chicago St. 70, Texas-Pan American 64
article.story: EDINBURG, Texas -- Carl Montgomery scored 23 points and grabbed 15 rebounds Saturday night to lead Chicago State to its first road victory of the season, 70-64 over Texas-Pan American. Montgomery fouled out with just over a minute to play and the Cougars leading 62-58. They held on down the stretch with free throws and are 1-12 away from home this season. Jonathon Montgomery scored 11 points for the Cougars (6-17, 3-4 Big West), who overcame a 35-28 halftime deficit. Chicago State was 19 for 22 from the free-throw line. Texas-Pan American (3-21, 0-7) has lost 15 in a row. Jared Maree led the Broncs with 15 points. Brandon Provost and Matt Mierzycki scored 13 each and Mierzycki contributed nine rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
